title: Well.... jungle Nidalee was fun while it lasted boys!
body:
H2K running it in LCS... Nidalee has completely shut down enemy JG Elise and is 4-0 13 minutes in. 

Get your fill in boys, guarantee gutted next patch.

replies.body: In Nidalee's defense, Elise isn't much of an opponent. She has a much harder time against the big 3.

Honestly bigger problem than Nida jungle is these Graves / Annie combos every game. Just instant blow up any team. I really think Annie should lose cast range on her Tibbers, combined with how big the AoE is... with a well timed flash it's just impossible to avoid.
Really, to fix Annie, they just have to keep doing more of what they did last season, nerf her base damage and buff her scaling so she has to build real AP to actually burst people.

She already has ridiculous scaling on all her abilities.

.8 on a point and click nuke with a 4 second cooldown
.85 on her E
.8 on the initial burst of her R, plus .2 per second for up to 45 seconds

I can't think of a single other champion with 3 80+% ratios.

Tibbers lasts a massive 45 seconds, and they just gave it that speed boost thing. IMO, they should reduce Tibbers burst damage, and increase his DoT. Why does he stick around for such an insane amount of time if most of the damage is loaded into an instant AoE nuke? Tibbers should be more about area denial and consistent damage over time.
Then just reduce the base damage and compensate in different ways, like giving her more champion-pet relationships and control like they tried with molten shield.

Ya I couldn't agree more. Annie should be all about tibbers. He even appears in all her splash art. But there isn't really any massive incentive to actually care about him once he's been dropped. Sure he does pretty decent DoT, and can block skill shots. And you can have him tank turrets/skill shots, etc. But the spell is essentially just a massive nuke; the actual pet feels like an afterthought.

Yea her damage is an issue but its her stupid ass AoE stun that really pisses me off, that and her ridiculously huge AA range. Like i can deal with getting stunned, because i trust my support or ADC to do something while i cant, but with Annie we are usually both stunned and there is nothing that can be done. She can stun you from so far away too so its not like you have much time to react while you are farming or trading.

What they need to do is give her ult the Corki treatment and make it a projectile, 
then probably buff the damage or something to compensate.
While a flying rocket torpedo Tibbers would be hilarious to see, I don't see that being terribly practical for our little demon child to be doing haha.

I mean have it work like in the short "A Twist of Fate"
Where she tosses her teddy bear and it transforms into tibbers mid-air
Ah, gotcha. That makes sense, I had forgotten about that cinematic.

Also I was referring to the change riot made in season 3 with Corki's Q.

It used to deal instant, unreactable damage in a radius 
But in patch 3.14, they changed it to the projectile it is today and as a result they could buff it to be stronger

Not cast range change (or it will hurt mid annie too) but make her stun have "x second" to be cast or she must do 4 spell again. (that way mid annie is not hurt too hard has she can rush mana regen while support annie will have to make impactfull decision)
Seeing her sitting on it for 1 min is the most annoying thing
I agree about the range, she already has to flash in to use Tibbers half the time, lol.
If you're upset about Support Annie, it's important that they nerf *Support* Annie, and not Annie in general.

She isn't that OP, she just got lucky, and most people could see that. In the UOL v Fnatic match, she wasn't nearly as overwhelming and it was a much closer game. SK got it first game and simply executed better than H2K's jungler (which is understandable since they are currently the top rated EU team this split). I doubt they will nerf bat her more than maybe a little bit of damage off of her Spear or takedown, not much else.

That UOL comeback though, that was truly Impressive.

> [{quoted}](name=junglerboy16,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Ew0UzgBW,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-02-05T19:23:30.517+0000)
>
> She isn't that OP, she just got lucky, and most people could see that. In the UOL v Fnatic match, she wasn't nearly as overwhelming and it was a much closer game. SK got it first game and simply executed better than H2K's jungler (which is understandable since they are currently the top rated EU team this split). I doubt they will nerf bat her more than maybe a little bit of damage off of her Spear or takedown, not much else.
> 
> That UOL comeback though, that was truly Impressive.

I don't know man, if it's good enough to be played at the LCS level I think Nid will be an absolute terror solo Q where people aren't nearly as good at awareness / dodging skill shots, and snowballing is a much larger factor due to people giving up and being negative as soon as they are behind.

So, I'm something of a mid lane AP Nidalee main, I kind of have a strong opinion about this. Basically I think AP Nidalee jungle is going to fall off in a few weeks time even if she doesn't get nerfed. Maybe I'll eat my words, I don't know, her win rates have gone up in the past week or so. If they do "nerf" anything though, ~~I think they'll just change her hunt reset passive so she can't reset her pounce multiple times in a jungle camp (killing units is probably fair game, but IIRC she can reset the pounce on hunted monsters multiple times, instead of just once per monster), since that's just abusive and I'm pretty sure isn't working as intended~~ (Edit: Either I recalled incorrectly or they stealth fixed it; tested it in a custom, it doesn't work. Watching some more videos on jungle Nidalee, the root actually prevents her from taking a lot of damage in jungle because she is ranged in her human form; basically it's a Nidalee-specific work-around to the soft-leash change they made that killed all the other ranged junglers). I honestly don't think they'll take any damage off of her, because, as you saw, her damage isn't that threatening coming from a jungle Nidalee in the mid game (early game she's got a lot of burst, but that's kind of the only window she has to snowball herself), since she's behind in gold compared to a solo laner.

Sven got *4 early kills* to snowball him and then what? He was basically just healing people the rest of the game. That's all AP Nidalee provides; damage, heals, and a bit of 'vision' with her traps. She's not building tanky so your team is down a traditional front liner in their jungle; even an assassin like Kha'Zix or Rengar builds tank after like two damage items, sometimes earlier. She's naturally down in gold because she's in the jungle, so her damage in the mid game isn't fantastic unless she gets insanely fed. She doesn't have any CC to set up kills for anyone other than herself. You basically have to build a team around an under-fed mid laner, because she's not going to be donating many resources (kills, farm) to her team the way other junglers can afford to, since she *needs* the gold for items to be relevant. Maybe you stall for late game for her to get full build, but then everyone on the enemy team has a Banshee's Veil and your spears are practically useless unless someone else on your team is bringing poke or something to pop the Banshee's.

Couple that with the fact that she's innately difficult to play from the jungle even for pro players. Yeah, she's probably the most mobile champion in jungle in the game just because of her dash and her passive through brush, but landing a spear from the jungle into lane for a gank is one of the most difficult spears to hit (jungle -> jungle isn't bad since pathways are a bit more narrow, and if you're in lane, lane -> lane isn't bad either since you can afford to wait for a good opening, as well minions form barriers that make it easier to funnel spears around); it's traveling as slow as like a Morgana binding with like 1/5th of the hitbox; player movements are much more difficult to judge when you're coming from the side rather than coming from lane, and if you miss or you have to wait around for a good spear to line up, you're wasting a ton of time as a jungler where other junglers can just force a gank much more easily.

I watch a lot of Nightblue3, and it's been annoying me lately how high he's rating Nidalee jungle because I really disagree with him; heck I've seen him play games where he gets insanely fed in the early game, and then can't do anything for the rest of the game; basically the same thing that happened to Sven in SK's game.

Again, maybe I'll eat my words, I don't know, but in my mind coming from what I understand about AP Nidalee, knowing what a mid-lane AP Nidalee is capable of and seeing what a jungle Nidalee can do, I don't see jungle Nidalee being more than a passing fad just because of how she works as a champion and how the jungle works. Sure you can probably get away with her in solo-q, but you can get away with *a lot* of things in solo q, lol.

I agree 100%, the only thing I will say is that this isn't entirely about Jungle Nid vs Lane Nid, it is more about Jungle Nid vs other Junglers. I've seen some top notch Nid players (like RF Legendary for example) who are experienced with her already take her jungle and roflstomp everything because they do better than the other jungler. I agree that right now Nid jungle isn't OP, but she is still good. She would probably become much more popular if more tank top laners were popular and more tank supports (to make up for her trying to be a carry type jungler), but for now, since that isn't the case she will just be a good pick, not an amazing pick.

I might be off on this but I honestly feel like AD jungle Nidalee is a much more long term (*not* top tier or anything, but more stable if at all) pick than AP jungle Nidalee; squishy AP junglers not named Fiddlesticks (who builds Zhonyas, can silence your entire team, and drain-tanks for days) or *maybe* Karthus (where it doesn't *really* matter if he gets blown up cause he can still cast spells when he's dead) generally have a rough time (besides them it's like, Diana, who's more of a bruiser/fighter, and like, Kayle, who's more about attack speed and on-hit damage in the current meta, and also makes a teammate invincible for a few seconds). There are some other odd ball picks (jungle Teemo, Heimerdinger), and your AP off-builds for tanky junglers (Amumu, Rammus, Zac, etc) but it's very rare for a reason I'd say. It's just awkward since AD Nidalee is much weaker than AP Nidalee overall right now.

> I've seen some top notch Nid players (like RF Legendary for example) who are experienced with her already take her jungle and roflstomp everything because they do better than the other jungler.

I think that's more about just being a top notch Nidalee than Nidalee actually being *especially* good in jungle. It's like bringing Lee Sin mid lane; it's a weird pick that is difficult to pull off, but if you're like, inSec or Faker (yes I've seen Faker play Lee Sin mid), you'll still crush faces. Looking at the two games we saw yesterday, we saw Sven, who's a very good player, play some pretty good Nidalee, was landing his spears, etc. and we saw Kikis, also a good player who's used to bringing out odd picks like TF or Kayle or Wukong, and I hardly saw him hit anything. To me it's like, sure, if Bischu (or again, Faker) have to fill in jungle, they can bring Nidalee now since she's playable, but I'm not going to be recommending people pick up AP jungle Nidalee as the next freelo 420 Weedwick pick, lol.

Like, I've seen Faker play a lot of jungle Riven; it's not because Riven is an especially good jungler, it's because Faker is an insane Riven player that enables her to be played in jungle. Sure Nidalee has some stuff to compliment a jungle playstyle over some of these other picks (like how she can hunt monsters), but imo that doesn't suddenly make up for all the other cons in playing Nidalee in jungle.

EDIT: In my mind the only thing that makes jungle Nidalee marginally better than picks like Yasuo, Zed, Riven, etc. is the fact that she has this somewhat abusive ~~reset~~ mechanic on hunted monsters, ~~which I'm pretty sure isn't working as intended (on champions you only reset once per hunted debuff); once that gets removed (which I'd be surprised if they didn't because again, doesn't seem like it's intentional)~~ (edit: I'll explain in EDIT2, lol), ~~she'll probably be just as niche if not worse than the aforementioned champions because she's innately a situational pick.~~ (edit: I'll explain in EDIT3 lmao)

EDIT2: Just tested my own assumption; either I remembered incorrectly or they stealth fixed it, lol, pounce reset only works once per monster per debuff. Watching some other videos about jungle Nidalee, the root actually helps prevent her from taking too much early damage in jungle, which I just realized is basically a Nidalee-specific work around to the soft-leash changes that killed all the other ranged junglers, which I also think is unintended; I saw the root more as something to make it easier for Nidalee to pounce to jungle camps (ie they don't run out of range when you toss a max range spear from behind a wall) or just something nice that makes it easier to hit skillshots when she's clearing. I'd expect a change here if anything; assuming I'm right about my guesses for intended use, maybe make it so her spears only root monsters at "max range" (1300-1500, where the spears are doing max damage), so she's well outside of auto attack range and can't use it to pseudo-soft-leash, but can still run towards and pounce to a monster over a larger wall.

EDIT3: While I still think she'll only really be a niche pick, I still think this AP jungle Nidalee is more a result of an abusive mechanic, and AD jungle Nidalee will be the more consistent pick if people still play her in jungle (especially if AD Nidalee gets some buffs that don't automatically make her a terror in top lane). A lot of people talk about AP Nidalee as a sleeper pick, which I'll agree with; she's situational, but can be very powerful *in the right hands*, which again, goes into the main point of this comment; I think champions like Riven or Nidalee will always be "sleeper OP" *in the right hands* just because they have so much outplay potential. Lord Master King just reached #1 in KR solo q as a Riven one trick pony, where Riven right now isn't exactly a high priority pick; he has a montage featuring *two* 1v1 kills on Faker's Yasuo (admittedly not his best champion, but considering how well he knows Riven and how to play against her, still very impressive). Sure they have metas where they struggle; Nidalee gets destroyed by mobile champions (ie. Fizz) since it's so difficult to hit a spear, and most other assassins, since again, mobility to dodge spears and also she's relatively weak at melee range if she can't get poke/Hunt debuff down first (if she can get poke down/Hunt debuff, she's very strong at melee range), for example. But overall point is that I think there are certain champions that, in the hands of a master, almost transcend a lot of metas because they're very dynamic as champions, and/or people who master them are just able adapt or play around different metas.

The main flaw in that thinking is that solo queue is dominated by singular powerful champions that don't need to work as a team. While this may be true for nidalee (she carries pretty hard), champions like Kalista pretty much SUCK in solo queue, because you need teamwork to succeed. Basically, seeing pro play does not equate to being immensely OP in solo queue. Maybe Duo queue, maybe ranked teams, but not solo queue. This also works in the converse, Swain is actually immensely potent in solo queue, but he is almost useless against a coordinated team that knows how to work together.
didn't beat lee sin so prolly wont be gutted
I find this really ironic tbh. Nidalee is built the way Elise was supposed to be built and played. As an assassin-y jungler with high pick potential.

Playing Nidalee is very hard.  Go ahead and try it before you think it's OP.  I've played about 100 games on her and most of the time i get wrecked.  Some times I do very good.

I started playing Vi recently, she's way more effective than Nidalee in my opinion.  With Vi I can chase anybody down and smash them that I want.  With Nidalee I have to land a spear first or my damage is minimal.  

When facing Nidalee all you have to do is stay behind the creeps and she can't hit you with that big spear attack.

Also the spear only does huge damage when she has levels on you and is fed with gold and has the items ahead of you.

But all champions in this game that are two levels above you and with items can do the same thing.

Nidalee is a very high skill champion to use.  If you don't think so try her and I bet you get wrecked with CC and miss a million to one skill shot spears.

Also I don't know how the pro's can clear camps that fast, When I play her I have to go back to base often due to creep damage.  I'm going to watch the LCS to see how they do it more efficiently.

> [{quoted}](name=Anatharion,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Ew0UzgBW,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2015-02-05T19:33:57.094+0000)

As a Nid main..I can assure you she is not that hard..she's all about prediction..if you have a good sense of enemy movement you will land almost every spear and bully them out of lane.

Would probably be better to just watch a stream because I doubt you're gonna get too much of an idea of the nuances of how pros jungle from watching LCS XD

The camera pretty much never focuses on a jungler just clearing his camps

> [{quoted}](name=ThePlasticSpork,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Ew0UzgBW,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2015-02-06T04:15:24.437+0000)
>
> Would probably be better to just watch a stream because I doubt you're gonna get too much of an idea of the nuances of how pros jungle from watching LCS XD
> 
> The camera pretty much never focuses on a jungler just clearing his camps

They actually focused on her quite a bit in the first game and kept calling out what abilities she leveled up first and what camps she cleared because the announcers were interested in it. 

But yea, both Oddone and NB3 have done it as well.
Elise shouldn't even be picked anymore, whatever team that was their jungler is pulling them back from winning lmao.
honestly, I wish her primary role was jungle. It makes sense.
Well it was played in LCS so the trend is usually we see it spammed for a patch, then promptly nerfed. ;)

Nidalee Jungle has always been a thing and the recent chang doesn't make that much of a difference.

 That was just a good game.

Nah, it's just strong cus LOLOLOL INVISISPEARS.

edit: guys. sarcasm.
i haven't seen one yet

I hadn't until very recently, and had never seen a screenshot of them, so I honestly wasn't sure they existed. And then all the sudden I got chunked for 1/4 of my hp from a max range spear. Also, I think they only happen on the headhunter nid skin.

They're not completely invisible -- the invisible part is the shaft of the spear, so all you can see is the two slivers at the front where it widens a little.
Only 1/4th of your hp? You got off easy :P (source: I main AP Nidalee)

To be fair, this is jungle nid we're talking about, who's considerably less farmed than her lane counterpart.

Also, I was playing ashe top. Faster than my arrow? I think not.

(Their riven... oh, that poor riven).

Edit: Just looked at [the match](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1718439441/208615052?tab=overview): She had 4.7k at 20 min and 7.9k at 30.

Looking at the timing of the kills and stuff, we see that by the 10 minute mark she wasn't even bothering to stay in lane because I wouldn't give her a single CS.

"Ashe, how are you 4/2?" -Their team, 20 min mark
"People tried to stop my from farming." -Me
Lol I'm well aware, scroll up, I have a pretty strong opinion about ap jungle Nidalee
well, giving jungle clear utily to a character who has lee sin jump without the need of landing a Q was maybe a wrong idea :p
You do need to land Q, or they need to walk into W, otherwise you get a lot shorter leap.

My point was more about the "no cost" jump over the wall to invade/escape enemy jungle with ease

All those kind of spell make a jungler top tier the second he gain it (lee, rek'sai, now nida), I don't know why poeple seems surprise with the nidalee case.

Every jungle nidalee I've seen in game has actually played her really well.  So honestly I wonder if it's op. My last game the opposing team started trap and she managed to clear 14 jungle monsters (5 camps) and gank for a kill in the time I managed to kill the same 5 camps (and I hadn't recalled,  and was perilously low health after 5 camps). I thought clearing 5 camps before recalling was great (most junglers only manage 3),  but seeing her do the same,  faster,  and with health leftover to gank (and get a kill) was shocking.  

So I can't say first hand if it's op as I haven't played it,  but playing against it,  she seems to be over tuned for the jungle.  Not to mention her Spears coming out of no where,  she killed me from over half health at level 5 or 6 with a spear from a Bush when I was freezing a Lane outside turret range for a teammate... and I never even saw the spear hit me, didn't get vision of it until I was dead. 

Might take time but seems strong

I played it once, and I did pretty ok even though I'm terrible at both jungling and hitting spears, and had not played the reworked nidalee a single time before that. The sustain on first clear is ridiculous, and the speed is good as well. Ganks are meh, but if top lane is overextended just a little there's no real escape from her, and on any lane if she hits a spear the laner is practically dead. The only thing that stops her from being terribly broken is that she kind of sucks in teamfights.
jungle nid 4-0 in the lcs

J4 and Lee can kill her pretty easier if they catch her in jungle. I like jungle nid (but i'm a nid fan), because it allowed me to play the game the way i want to play it. I hope they don't nerf her. I'm tired of playing Nid in lane.

> [{quoted}](name=Killer X 12,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=Ew0UzgBW,comment-id=001a,timestamp=2015-02-06T19:23:30.116+0000)
>
> J4 and Lee can kill her pretty easier if they catch her in jungle. I like jungle nid (but i'm a nid fan), because it allowed me to play the game the way i want to play it. I hope they don't nerf her. I'm tired of playing Nid in lane.

mabye if both are at full hp lvl 6+ but early game nid can full clear and have almost full hp without backing. nid can easily solo invade early and get kills.

Right, and that is what everyone expects. You always have your 2nd buff warded when you go against a jungle nidalee. 

Also her clear speed is slower than that i'm used to since i jungle Diana. lol

not sure why people are saying jungle nid is an "ok" jungler but not great. she has some of the fastest clear times out of any jungler, sustain, mobility, range, poke and burst. she can fully clear both buffs and be near full hp for ganks. she can solo drag lvl4+ after first back. shes also 3-0 in the lcs and people are now banning her. 

the nid hype is real and for good reason.
Did she beat Lee? If she beat Lee, the nerfs are already getting worked on as we speak.
